The film depicts the love story and romance between the painter Pierre Bonnard and his wife, model, and muse Marthe. The film stars Cécile de France as Marthe and Vincent Macaigne as Pierre.

Film: Green Border, opens Aug. 9, Sudbury Indie Cinema (sudburyindiecinema.com). In the treacherous and swampy forests that make up the so-called “green border” between Belarus and Poland, refugees from the Middle East and Africa are lured by government propaganda promising easy passage to the European Union. Unable to cross into Europe and unable to turn back, they find themselves trapped in a rapidly escalating geopolitical stand-off.

Film: Only The River Flows, opens Aug. 9, Sudbury Indie Cinema (sudburyindiecinema.com). In China, in the 1990s, three murders were committed in the small town of Banpo. Ma Zhe, the head of the criminal police, is responsible for solving the case. A handbag abandoned by the river and testimonies from passers-by point to several suspects. As the case stalls, Inspector Ma is confronted with the darkness of the human soul and sinks into doubt.

Broadway fans are in their element on Mondays at 11 a.m. as they tune into Sounds of Broadway. Allan Walsh’s take on the jazz world in Jazz Sounds is always worth listening to on Wednesdays at 2 p.m. JazzMania airing Saturdays at 6 p.m. is equally informative and entertaining. Most CKLU radio shows are aired twice weekly. Check out the schedule at cklu.ca and listen to what you love.

50/50 draw: The Sudbury Manitoulin Children’s Foundation has announced its online 50/50 raffle to raise money for children in need. Funds will go directly into helping marginalized children in the districts of Sudbury and Manitoulin attend camp, sports, or leisure activities. They will also help eligible wards attend post-secondary education by emptying the organization’s waitlist.

The purpose of the event is to provide both new and veteran trail users with a nature experience. A self-guided hike is involved. For more information and to register, visit socialmediarra@gmail.com.

Garlic food fest: A Ukrainian garlic food fest will be held on Aug. 25 from 11 a.m. to sell-out at the Ukrainian Centre, 30 Notre Dame Ave. There will be a variety of garlic nibbler items available, fresh pyrohy and cabbage rolls packaged to go, vendors, and light entertainment. Vendor spaces are available (call 705-673-7404).

Golf: Celebrate 40 remarkable years of Science North by competing in the Bluecoat Open, a fundraising golf tournament at Pine Grove Golf Club on Sept. 18. The entry cost is $800 for a team of four and includes 18 holes of golf, a barbecue lunch on the course, a dinner from Boy Gorgeous Catering Co. at Science North, prizes and giveaways. Participants will be shuttled from Science North to the Pine Grove Golf Club. The event will run from 10:30 a.m.-9 p.m. By entering the Bluecoat Open, you will have a chance to win two tickets to Canada vs. USA and Finland vs. Latvia gameson Dec. 31 at the 2025 IIHF World Junior Hockey Championships in Ottawa. For more information, visit www.sciencenorth.ca/golf, send an email to development manager Dave Hysen at dave.hysen@sciencenorth.ca, or call 705-522-3701, ext. 211.

Ball hockey: Lace up your runners for a weekend of ball hockey action for the 3 on 3 Ball Hockey Tournament at Delki Dozzi on Sept. 21-22. Event to support the Sudbury Food Bank. Organizers looking for teams and sponsors. Teams interested in participating in the tournament can register at www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61558849685315 and can contact Vanessa Sawyer at vanessasawyerjhc@gmail.com for more information. Businesses interested in sponsoring the event should contact Sawyer at vanessasawyerjhc@gmail.com.

Film: Cinéfest Sudbury organizers, in partnership with CTV, are thrilled to launch the Best in Shorts competition for 2024. The film competition provides Northern Ontario filmmakers the opportunity to advance their careers; have their work screened to a festival audience; receive exposure within the film industry; and have a chance to compete for a variety of cash prizes. All entries must be accompanied by an application form, which can be downloaded at cinefest.com. Finalists selected by the jury will be announced following the submission deadline on July 12 at 4:30 p.m. The 36th edition of Cinéfest Sudbury takes place Sept. 14-22.

Tickets

Music and art: Up Here festival’s 10th edition runs this year from Aug. 15-18. For passes, visit tinyurl.com/2z26djw9.

Film: Cinefest Sudbury is allowing cinephiles to get a head start by reserving their film festival passport early. The 2024 passport and passport+ will be available with an early-bird discount for a limited time. Passports, which will be available for pick-up early in the summer, can be pre-ordered at cinefest.com; at the box office, 40 Larch St.; or by calling 705-688-1234. The 36th edition of Cinéfest Sudbury International Film Festival takes place Sept. 14-22.

Business: Join the Greater Sudbury Chamber of Commerce on Sept. 17 at Bryston’s on the Park, 5 Creighton Rd. in Copper Cliff, from 12-2 p.m. to welcome Laurentian University’s new president, Dr. Lynn Wells, with a president’s series luncheon. Doors will open at 11:30 a.m. Lunch will be served at noon. To purchase your tickets, go to sudburychamber.ca.

Health: Tickets are now on sale for the Northern Cancer Foundation’s 26th-annual Luncheon of Hope set for noon at the Caruso Club on Sept. 24 . For more information, call the NCF at 705-523-7130.

Music: The Kilgour Group presents Green River Revival and Scarecrow – a CCR with John Fogerty and John Mellencamp tribute show – at the Caruso Club in support of Our Children, Our Future on Sept. 26. Doors open at 6:30 p.m. General admission is $40 and a $2 online transaction fee. To purchase tickets, visit www.ocof.net or call Lynne Ethier at 705-561-2666.

Music: Global icon Paula Abdul has announced a 2024 Canadian tour. She will be joined by very special guests Taylor Dayne and Tiffany. Abdul and friends will stop by the Sudbury Community Arena on Oct. 17. Tickets can be purchased online at greatersudbury.ca/tickets; by phone at 705-671-3000; and in person at 240 Elgin St.

Circus: Tickets for Cirque Musica Holiday Wonderland, which plays at the Sudbury Arena on Nov. 21, can be purchased online at greatersudbury.ca/tickets, by phone at 705-671-3000, or in person at 240 Elgin St. at the arena. For more information visit, www.cirquemusica.com.

Magic (ticket sales open): Following a decade touring the world as one of the most successful magic shows in history, the Champions of Magic team are back with an explosive new show featuring thrilling and mind-bending illusions. Catch this incredible show — suitable for the whole family — at the Sudbury Arena on Dec. 8 at 6 p.m. Tickets start at $61.55. Tickets go on sale Friday at 10 a.m. and can be purchased online at greatersudbury.ca/tickets; by phone at 705-671-3000; or in person at 240 Elgin St.
